alert.note: Alert for Motherlode; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 3:45PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Sacramento, northeastern San Joaquin, southwestern El Dorado, southwestern Placer, west central Calaveras and southwestern Amador Counties through 430 PM PDT... At 342 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Granite Bay to Camanche Reservoir. Movement was northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roseville, Citrus Heights, Folsom, Rocklin, Auburn, Jackson, Fair Oaks, Paloma, El Dorado Hills, Cameron Park, Carmichael, Rancho Cordova, Lincoln, Ione, Loomis, Rancho Murieta, Gold River, Campo Seco, Latrobe and Newcastle. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near a lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Motherlode; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley
